What is this comment all about?
Does using ServletHolder via ServletContextHandler change the behavior in some way?

The decoration of the listener happens when the listener instance is created. If you call ServletContext.createListener(Class), then the instance is created at that point and the decoration happens at that point.  If you call ServletHandler.addListener(ListenerHolder), the ListenerHolder delays the creation of the instance until the holder is started, thus the decoration and adding of the listener instance to the ServletHandler happens at a different point.
Does a servlet added via the dynamic ServletContext.addServlet() methods during servlet init trip this up in any way?

No,  ServletContext.addServlet() impl always creates a ServletHolder and adds it to the ServletHandler list of ServletHolders. The ServletHandler.initialize() method isn't called during the start sequence until AFTER the ServletContainerInitializers have already been called (and thus any ServletHolders created by the SCI will already have been added to the ServletHandler).
We need a way to ensure that contextDestroyed is called by the ContextHandler if there is no ServletHandler present.
In this PR or can this be done in a further PR?

Let's get it done in this PR as it might need a little adjusting.
The issue being that it is asymmetric.... if there is a ServletHandler, then ContextHandler need not call contextDestroyed, but ContextHandler doesn't know about ServletHandlers.
So perhaps ContextHandler should have a marker interface called something like ContextDestroyer, that ServletHandler can implement.   It will have no methods, but ContextHandler can check if any of it's contained handlers implements ContextDestroyer, and if so then it doesn't call contextDestoyed.
